headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  DENNY, MARGARET MCGUINNESS

snippet: DENNY--Margaret McGuinness, died peacefully on April 23, 2016, at her Park Place Nursing Home, after an eight year struggle with Alzhiemer's Disease. She turned 80 years old in March. Margaret, known as "Ticky," was born and raised in Chestnut Hill, PA. After graduating from Springside School and the Rhode Island School of Design, she married John H. Denny and resided in Princeton, NJ for 55 years. Margaret was a longtime member of the Bedens Brook Club in Skillman, NJ and the Ausable Club in the Adirondacks. Her father, Dr. Aims C. McGuinness was the Under Secretary of Health, Education, and Welfare (1957-1959) in the Eisenhower administration. Margaret is survived by her husband, John; her brother, Aims C. McGuinness, of Littleton, CO; her daughter, Elise Anderson, of Manitou Springs, CO; her son, John, Jr. of Princeton, NJ, and six grandchildren. A small service for family and friends is planned for early July in the Adirondacks. 1/3
